home_pitcher_note: A good spring can’t hurt a pitcher’s chances in terms of Opening Day honors, but in Bundy’s case, that wasn’t what drove manager Joe Maddon’s decision. Bundy had a strong year in 2020, posting a 3.29 ERA and 1.036 WHIP over 11 starts.
away_pitcher_note: Giolito earned his second straight Opening Day start, making him the first White Sox right-hander to have such an honor since Jaime Navarro in 1997-98. Giolito fanned 30 over 23 Cactus League innings in six Arizona starts.
summary: 2021-04-01 - Chicago White Sox (3) @ Los Angeles Angels (4) (Final)

home_pitcher_note: Heaney was the club's Opening Day starter in 2020 and had a 4.46 ERA in 12 starts with 70 strikeouts in 66 2/3 innings. He'll look to continue to try to cut down on his homers allowed, which has been an issue for him.
away_pitcher_note: The left-hander begins his second season with the White Sox, looking to build off a tremendous debut in which he produced a 1.99 ERA in 11 starts. The veteran feels ready to go after throwing 11 1/3 Cactus League innings.
summary: 2021-04-02 - Chicago White Sox (12) @ Los Angeles Angels (8) (Final)

home_pitcher_note: Cobb is set to make his Angels debut and is showing improved velocity after fixing his mechanics in the offseason with a trip to Driveline. Cobb had a 4.30 ERA in 10 starts with Baltimore in 2020.
away_pitcher_note: Lynn came to the White Sox in a trade with Texas for Dane Dunning and provides the team with a solid No. 3 option in the rotation. Lynn has thrown at least 200 innings in three seasons and worked 84 innings in 2020.
summary: 2021-04-03 - Chicago White Sox (3) @ Los Angeles Angels (5) (Final)

home_pitcher_note: Ohtani had an incredible Spring Training, reaching 102 mph, but dealt with a blister in his final start. Ohtani, though, is healthy otherwise and believes it won't affect him going forward.
away_pitcher_note: Cease’s 4.01 ERA in 2020 dropped from 5.79 in his 2019 debut, but the right-hander wasn’t satisfied with his season after walking 34 in 58 1/3 innings. Cease produced a 0.77 Cactus League ERA with seven walks in 11 2/3 innings.
summary: 2021-04-04 - Chicago White Sox (4) @ Los Angeles Angels (7) (Final)

home_pitcher_note: Sheffield will look to follow up his stellar rookie season when he makes his 2021 debut against a loaded White Sox lineup, one that features many of the same faces who tagged him for a career-high six runs in September 2019. Sheffield had a strong spring, throwing 92 pitches in his final tune-up during a live BP.
away_pitcher_note: Rodon was non-tendered by the White Sox this past offseason but brought back two months later via free agency and had a tremendous Spring Training. He is fully healthy after throwing 42 1/3 innings over the last two seasons.

home_pitcher_note: Paxton was initially slated to start Game 2 on Friday, but he was pushed back due to what manager Scott Servais summed up to extra rest. He made just two Cactus League starts due to work visa issues, but he looked stellar in both outings, striking out 17 over 8 1/3 innings.
away_pitcher_note: The White Sox ace was solid in his second straight Opening Day start, striking out eight and walking two over 5 1/3 innings. The right-hander’s changeup was especially effective, as he allowed just two runs before leaving.

home_pitcher_note: The righty will get to put all of his revamped weapons to the test of the regular season when he starts the series finale against Chicago. Dunn dialed his fastball up to 96 mph in Spring Training, and he had much sharper breaking pitches. But command, at times, eluded him.
away_pitcher_note: Keuchel’s first start against the Angels lasted just four-plus innings before he was replaced by Matt Foster. The veteran southpaw allowed six runs (three earned), with four strikeouts and two walks.

home_pitcher_note: The home opener start goes to Lynn, who makes his second trip to the mound for the White Sox. Lynn threw 99 pitches over 4 2/3 innings against the Angels Saturday, striking out six and walking two with no earned runs.
away_pitcher_note: Keller will look to rebound after a shaky start on Opening Day, when he allowed six earned runs on nine hits in 1 1/3 innings against the Rangers. It was the shortest Opening Day start in franchise history.
summary: 2021-04-08 - Kansas City Royals (0) @ Chicago White Sox (6) (Final)
2021-04-10 - Kansas City Royals @ Chicago White Sox (Postponed)

home_pitcher_note: Cease threw 30 pitches during a two-run first inning against the Angels, but overcame the slow start to work 92 pitches and 4 2/3 innings in a no-decision. The right-hander struck out three, walked three and yielded three runs.
away_pitcher_note: Minor made it through six innings on April 3 against the Rangers, but he allowed four runs on four hits in his season debut. Minor struck out six, though, while allowing just two walks. Because of the rainout, he will pitch on eight days' rest against the White Sox.
summary: 2021-04-11 - Kansas City Royals (4) @ Chicago White Sox (3) (Final)

home_pitcher_note: The veteran southpaw posted a 1.99 ERA in 2020, but he's off to a slower start through his first two starts this season. Keuchel has allowed seven earned runs over nine innings pitched, with seven strikeouts and five walks.
away_pitcher_note: Monday marks the first time Cleveland needs a fifth starter, and McKenzie earned the spot. He didn't have the strongest spring campaign, but he bounced back nicely in his first relief outing, allowing one run on two hits in 3 2/3 frames.

home_pitcher_note: Giolito has struck out 18 over 10 2/3 innings this season, working 5 1/3 innings in each of his two West Coast starts. He fanned 10 against the Mariners in his start on April 6 and has walked just three with six hits allowed.
away_pitcher_note: Bieber's top priority entering the 2021 season was getting deeper into games than he did in 2020. Even though he has already turned in two quality starts, he will be looking to work even deeper into the game against the White Sox.

home_pitcher_note: Rodón was scheduled to make his regular start in Monday’s series opener against Cleveland, but he was scratched due to a stomach issue and replaced by Dallas Keuchel. Barring a setback, Rodón will take the mound on Wednesday.
away_pitcher_note: Plesac was stellar last time out, tossing seven scoreless frames against the Tigers while permitting just three hits with no walks and six strikeouts. In five career starts against the White Sox, Plesac has pitched to a 3.03 ERA and a 0.918 WHIP.

home_pitcher_note: The right-hander was truly dominant in his home opener shutout against the Royals on April 8. Lynn struck out 11 over 111 pitches without issuing a walk, recording his fourth career complete game and second shutout.
away_pitcher_note: Civale looks to keep his win streak alive on Thursday. The right-hander has made two starts this season -- both against the Tigers -- and secured two wins. He owns a 2.45 ERA in 14 2/3 innings with three walks and 12 strikeouts.

summary: 2021-04-16 - Chicago White Sox @ Boston Red Sox (Postponed)

home_pitcher_note: By winning his last start, Pivetta became the first Red Sox starter since Tim Wakefield in 1995 to win his first four starts with the club. Pivetta pitched well against the White Sox in two relief appearances in 2019, but this will be his first career start against them.
away_pitcher_note: Cease has made two starts and thrown exactly 4 2/3 innings in each one. He has allowed four runs while striking out nine, though he has walked six and thrown 182 pitches between those two outings.
summary: 2021-04-17 - Chicago White Sox (4) @ Boston Red Sox (7) (Final)

home_pitcher_note: Houck will be called up from the Red Sox's alternate training site to start the opener of Sunday's doubleheader. Houck allowed three runs (two earned) over five innings in his lone start this season on April 3 against the Orioles.
away_pitcher_note: It wasn’t until 5 p.m. CT on Monday when Keuchel, who was scheduled to take the mound on Wednesday, knew he would be starting in place of Carlos Rodón. The left-hander worked five-plus innings, giving the White Sox a chance to win the game in the ninth.
summary: 2021-04-18 - Chicago White Sox (3) @ Boston Red Sox (2) (Final)

home_pitcher_note: The lefty has done his job so far this season and kept the team in both games he has pitched. Pérez is 2-5 in 11 career starts at Fenway but still hasn't won there as a member of the Red Sox.
summary: 2021-04-18 - Chicago White Sox (5) @ Boston Red Sox (1) (Final)

home_pitcher_note: The flame-throwing righty is off to a tremendous start, giving up two earned runs or fewer in his first three outings. Eovaldi has 14 strikeouts and four walks in 17 1/3 innings, and he's 1-1 with a 5.59 ERA in three appearances lifetime against the White Sox.
away_pitcher_note: Giolito threw a masterful seven shutout frames his last time out against Cleveland in a pitchers' duel with Shane Bieber. Through three starts, Giolito has struck out 26 batters with just five walks across 17 2/3 innings.
summary: 2021-04-19 - Chicago White Sox (4) @ Boston Red Sox (11) (Final)

home_pitcher_note: Plesac will look to bounce back from the shortest outing of his career his last time out. At Guaranteed Rate Field on Wednesday, Plesac lasted just two-third of an inning and was charged with six runs on seven hits before his early departure.
away_pitcher_note: Rodón threw the 20th no-hitter in White Sox franchise history against the Indians on Wednesday, retiring the first 25 batters before hitting Roberto Pérez with a slider. Rodón has allowed two hits across 14 innings with 16 strikeouts.

home_pitcher_note: Cease has made three starts this season and has lasted 4 2/3 innings in each of those three. He has walked nine and struck out 15 over 14 innings, averaging 89 pitches per trip to the mound.
away_pitcher_note: Dunning returns to Chicago, where he made his Major League debut with the White Sox last season. He heads into his fourth start with a 0.60 ERA on the year.

home_pitcher_note: Keuchel’s fifth start comes against the Rangers on Saturday night, but he has not completed six innings in any of his first four. Keuchel has allowed 12 earned runs in 19 innings, with 10 strikeouts and seven walks.
away_pitcher_note: Gibson has pitched like the Rangers' ace this season. With a 2.53 ERA, he looks to continue his hot streak. The right-hander has not been scored upon in two of his four outings.

home_pitcher_note: Kopech will get his second start of the 2021 season during Sunday's series finale against the Rangers. Kopech takes the place of Lucas Giolito, who was pushed back following a cut to the top of his middle finger.
away_pitcher_note: Arihara gets an extra day of rest coming off a solid victory over the Angels on the last road trip. He's notched wins in each of his last two outings and he looks to continue on an upward trajectory in the Majors.

home_pitcher_note: Giolito was originally scheduled to start Sunday but was moved back a few days after suffering a cut on the top of his middle finger when trying to open a glass water bottle on Monday in Cleveland. He has thrown a bullpen and will be ready to go vs. Detroit.
away_pitcher_note: Ureña has been a strike-throwing, grounder-inducing machine his last two starts after walking nine batters over 7 2/3 innings in the two starts prior. He has tossed seven innings of two-run ball in those last two outings against the A’s and Pirates.

home_pitcher_note: Rodón will have eight days off in between starts before taking the mound on Thursday night against the Tigers. Rodón's last two starts have come against Cleveland, both victories, including the 20th no-hitter in franchise history.
away_pitcher_note: Mize gets a third career meeting with the White Sox, the team against which he made his MLB debut last year on Aug. 19. In those first two starts vs. Chicago, he struck out 12 batters over 9 2/3 innings in a pair of no-decisions, and took a no-hit bid into the sixth inning last Sept. 11.

home_pitcher_note: The right-hander has made four starts this season and has not completed five innings in any of them, lasting 3 1/3 innings Friday against Texas. Cease has nine career wins, with a 5-0 record vs. Detroit.
away_pitcher_note: Boyd’s stingy start to the season gets a test against a team that teed off on him last summer. The White Sox greeted him with back-to-back homers to begin his outing in back-to-back starts last August, with Tim Anderson leading off both times.

home_pitcher_note: Keuchel seems to have found his dominant form on the mound, coming off six scoreless innings against the Rangers on Saturday. Keuchel did not allow a walk and struck out two batters in Chicago's win.
away_pitcher_note: Bieber is coming off an outing against the Yankees in which he threw a career-high 119 pitches. He permitted two runs on four hits in seven innings with three walks and nine strikeouts -- the first time he recorded fewer than 10 K's this season.

home_pitcher_note: Lynn has been sidelined retroactive to April 17 with a right trapezius strain. But after the White Sox have taken their time with his recovery early in the season, he figures to be back in this series vs. Cleveland.
away_pitcher_note: McKenzie is winless in three starts this season as he's trying to find his command of the strike zone. The 23-year-old has allowed 14 walks and struck out 23 hitters in 16 2/3 innings this season. McKenzie has given up four home runs, with two coming in his last start against the Yankees.

home_pitcher_note: Giolito bounced back to hold down the Tigers for six innings before allowing four runs in the seventh as he ran out of gas approaching 114 pitches. Giolito has allowed 11 earned runs on 13 hits in his last 7 2/3 innings.
away_pitcher_note: For the third time in his last four starts, Plesac will face the White Sox. And in each of his first two outings against Chicago, he permitted six runs on seven hits. Last time out, he bounced back with a three-run, 7 2/3-inning start vs. the Twins.

home_pitcher_note: So far this season, Hoffman has been better at Great American Ball Park. He has a 1.69 ERA in three home starts compared to a 6.48 ERA in two road starts. This will be his second career game vs. the White Sox.
away_pitcher_note: After not getting through five innings in each of his first four starts, Cease threw his first complete game and shutout Thursday vs. Detroit. Cease improved to 6-0 lifetime vs. the Tigers, striking out nine with no walks.

home_pitcher_note: After two uneven starts in his return from a back injury, Gray appeared to be clicking Wednesday vs. the Dodgers, despite a loss. He struck out 11 in 5 2/3 innings.
away_pitcher_note: Keuchel was moved up to Wednesday and Carlos Rodón was pushed back to Friday in order to keep Keuchel on regular rest and give Rodón an extra few days. Keuchel has an 11-7 lifetime record in 27 Interleague games (26 starts).

home_pitcher_note: Keller ran into more bad luck in Sunday's game against the Twins, allowing seven runs (two earned) in a big third inning to be handed his third loss of the season. He made it through 4 1/3 innings with three strikeouts, but he's looking to bounce back with a quality start.
away_pitcher_note: It’s difficult to imagine a better April for Rodón. The southpaw threw a no-hitter against the Indians, allowing seven hits over four starts and 25 innings overall. He struck out 36, including a career-high 12 vs. Detroit.
summary: 2021-05-07 - Chicago White Sox (3) @ Kansas City Royals (0) (Final)

home_pitcher_note: Lynch will make his second career start, after his MLB debut on Monday against the Indians. The Royals' top pitching prospect was tagged for three runs on four hits and four walks in 4 2/3 innings with three strikeouts, but he flashed some elite stuff.
away_pitcher_note: Lynn earned the victory in his return from the injured list, working five innings during his first start since April 15. Lynn allowed three runs and had a streak of 66 batters faced without a walk come to an end.
summary: 2021-05-08 - Chicago White Sox (9) @ Kansas City Royals (1) (Final)

home_pitcher_note: Minor relied heavily on his fastball on Tuesday against the Indians, breezing through five innings before loading the bases and giving way to the bullpen in the sixth for the eventual loss. The outing was encouraging for Minor, who has struggled to go deep in games.
away_pitcher_note: Giolito suffered a tough-luck loss on Sunday. The right-hander allowed two runs (one earned) over 5 1/3 innings against Cleveland, while striking out eight. He has a career 7-2 record against the Royals.
summary: 2021-05-09 - Chicago White Sox (9) @ Kansas City Royals (3) (Final)

home_pitcher_note: Cease won’t get to hit Tuesday against the Twins after going 3-for-3 in his victory last Tuesday in Cincinnati. But he carries a 2.37 ERA and a 13-inning scoreless streak into his fourth career start vs. Minnesota.
away_pitcher_note: Maeda was scheduled to pitch Sunday's postponed game against Detroit, but he will be pushed back two days to the first of Minnesota's highly anticipated battles against the White Sox. He made his first scoreless appearance of 2021 in his last start.

home_pitcher_note: Keuchel pitched well enough to win against the Reds last Wednesday, allowing two hits and three walks against one strikeout over seven scoreless innings, but ended up with a no-decision. The southpaw has a 2.25 ERA over his last four starts covering 24 innings.
away_pitcher_note: Happ has been the Twins' most consistent starter to begin the season, with two or fewer runs allowed in each of his first five appearances. He'll face his biggest challenge against a White Sox team that is among the best in the Majors against lefties.

home_pitcher_note: Carlos Rodón was originally slated to start the series finale against the Twins. But due to tightness in his right hamstring and back, Rodón was moved back to Saturday against the Royals. Lynn made 20 starts for the Twins in 2018.
away_pitcher_note: Pineda was fine in his first outing after taking a comebacker off his right wrist, with two runs allowed to the Rangers in six innings. He has allowed more than two runs in only one of his six starts this season, with 32 strikeouts and seven walks.

home_pitcher_note: Giolito will start Game 1 of Friday's doubleheader against the Royals, followed by Michael Kopech. Since getting roughed up by Boston on April 19, Giolito has a 3.18 ERA over his last three starts. He is 8-2 with a 2.81 ERA vs. Kansas City.
away_pitcher_note: Keller held the White Sox hitless for 4 1/3 innings before giving up three runs on five hits in six innings last Friday. He struck out six and walked one, and despite being handed the loss, it was a step in the right direction for him after struggling to begin the season.
summary: 2021-05-14 - Kansas City Royals (6) @ Chicago White Sox (2) (Final)

home_pitcher_note: Kopech makes his third start of the season, and second in a doubleheader, when he takes the mound for Game 2 against the Royals on Friday. Kopech's last start came on April 25, when he struck out 10 Rangers over five innings.
away_pitcher_note: Junis will make his fifth start of the season and first since April 27, when he allowed two runs in 6 1/3 innings against the Pirates. The Royals moved Junis back to the ‘pen in May for a high-leverage arm, but he gave up seven runs in 4 2/3 innings over four relief appearances this month.
summary: 2021-05-14 - Kansas City Royals (1) @ Chicago White Sox (3) (Final)

home_pitcher_note: Rodón’s run of dominance continued vs. the Royals on May 7, as he improved to 5-0 with a 0.58 ERA in five stellar starts this season. Rodón has a 0.677 WHIP and has struck out 44 in 31 innings against 12 hits allowed and nine walks.
away_pitcher_note: Minor is still looking for his first quality start of the season after allowing five runs in five innings on Sunday against the White Sox. Minor has only gotten through six innings once this year, his first start against Texas.
summary: 2021-05-15 - Kansas City Royals (5) @ Chicago White Sox (1) (Final)

home_pitcher_note: Despite not having his best stuff on Tuesday, Cease gave the White Sox a chance to win over five innings after spotting the Twins a 3-0 lead in the second. Cease has fanned 27 over his last 18 innings pitched.
away_pitcher_note: Singer suffered some tough luck in his last start on Tuesday against the Tigers, but he also missed his target a few times, leading to four runs in 3 1/3 innings with four strikeouts and two walks. Singer scattered seven hits in the eventual no-decision.
summary: 2021-05-16 - Kansas City Royals (3) @ Chicago White Sox (4) (Final)

home_pitcher_note: Happ had been the Twins' most consistent starter early in 2021 before he was hit hard by the White Sox for nine runs on Wednesday, the most he allowed in a start in his career. He'll get another shot at the South Siders, seeking a better result.
away_pitcher_note: The Twins scored six runs on eight hits over 5 2/3 innings against Keuchel during their last matchup on May 12, but the White Sox offense propelled him to victory. Keuchel sits eight wins away from 100 for his career.

home_pitcher_note: Ober will make his Major League debut as a spot starter for Michael Pineda, who was scratched with a non-pitching-related ailment. Ober has a 1.29 ERA over two starts in Triple-A this year.
away_pitcher_note: The right-hander has thrown five innings in each of his three starts since coming off the injured list, winning all three and improving to 4-1 on the season. Lynn has allowed three earned runs with 17 strikeouts in those 15 innings.

home_pitcher_note: Shoemaker was one out away from a quality start on Friday against the A's before he gave up his third homer to push his line to five runs in six innings despite mostly solid execution throughout his outing. He last faced the White Sox in 2018.
away_pitcher_note: Giolito allowed five earned runs over his first 17 2/3 innings, covering three starts. But he has given up 18 earned runs over his last 24 innings, covering five starts. The right-hander is 3-2 with a 4.54 ERA at Target Field in his career.

home_pitcher_note: Montgomery struggled Sunday against the Orioles, going just three innings and allowing  five runs -- his shortest outing and most runs allowed this season. Before that, he had put together two consecutive quality starts to begin May.
away_pitcher_note: After five starts and five decisive victories, Rodón lost for the first time in 2021 during his last trip to the mound Saturday against the Royals. Rodón has 49 strikeouts against 12 walks over 36 2/3 innings this season.
summary: 2021-05-21 - Chicago White Sox (1) @ New York Yankees (2) (Final)

home_pitcher_note: Cole had an uncharacteristic start Monday against the Rangers, allowing five runs in five innings for just his second loss of the year. It was his shortest outing and most runs allowed this season, and he will look to prove that was merely an aberration.
away_pitcher_note: In parts of three seasons, the right-hander has never pitched at Yankee Stadium or even faced the Yankees. Cease only has two career starts against the American League East. He has fanned 50 batters over 41 innings in 2021.
summary: 2021-05-22 - Chicago White Sox (0) @ New York Yankees (7) (Final)

home_pitcher_note: Taillon is looking to find his footing in the early going, having compiled a 5.73 ERA in eight starts this season, with 46 strikeouts against only 10 walks. He has faced the White Sox only once in his career, going 5 2/3 innings in a no-decision in 2018.
away_pitcher_note: The White Sox have scored 13 runs and 16 runs, respectively, in each of Keuchel’s last two starts, which not surprisingly, both ended up as victories. Keuchel is 3-2 with a 2.45 ERA over five career starts at Yankee Stadium.
summary: 2021-05-23 - Chicago White Sox (4) @ New York Yankees (5) (Final)

home_pitcher_note: Lynn was drafted by the Cardinals in 2008 and spent six seasons in St. Louis. He has only faced his former team once, in 2018, when he gave up three runs before being pulled after three innings.
away_pitcher_note: Kim was limited to just 3 1/3 innings his last time out, as an erratic fourth frame handed him an early exit. Most concerning were the walks, with three tying a career high, two of which were offered to right-handers -- which he hadn't done since September 2020.
summary: 2021-05-24 - St. Louis Cardinals (1) @ Chicago White Sox (5) (Final)

home_pitcher_note: Giolito was dominant in his last outing, striking out 11 over eight innings. He is looking for his first win against the Cardinals, having taken the loss both times he faced them.
away_pitcher_note: Flaherty will face his longtime friend and former high school teammate in Lucas Giolito -- doing so amid one of the best stretches to open a season in Cards history. A win would propel him to 9-0 in his first 10 starts -- something never achieved by a Cardinal.
summary: 2021-05-25 - St. Louis Cardinals (3) @ Chicago White Sox (8) (Final)

home_pitcher_note: Rodón pitched six shutout innings at Yankee Stadium in his last outing, striking out 13 and lowering his ERA to 1.27. He will face the Cardinals for the first time since 2018, and for just the third time in his career.
away_pitcher_note: Gant was set for perhaps his best outing of the season in his last start before a comebacker and traffic in the sixth inning derailed his night. Nevertheless, the right-hander has been immaculate at navigating traffic, with just a 2.04 ERA despite a 1.56 WHIP.
summary: 2021-05-26 - St. Louis Cardinals (4) @ Chicago White Sox (0) (Final)

home_pitcher_note: Cease had gone eight straight starts allowing three earned runs or less before giving up five over 4 1/3 innings in a loss to the Yankees on Saturday. Cease, who has 56 strikeouts in 45 1/3 innings, has yet to face Baltimore in his career.
away_pitcher_note: Zimmermann endured the shortest start of his career last Saturday, allowing five runs in three innings vs. the Nationals. The rookie southpaw has completed five innings in just one of his past five starts.

home_pitcher_note: Keuchel committed his first error since 2017, leading to two unearned runs of the three he allowed in Sunday’s start. But the Yankees made him work, as he threw 100 pitches over four-plus innings in an outing that tied for his shortest of the season.
away_pitcher_note: Harvey won three of his first six starts but has now lost four straight. He allowed six runs (five earned) in 4 2/3 innings Sunday against the Nationals, and he owns an 8.85 ERA in May.

home_pitcher_note: Lynn carried a no-hitter into the sixth inning against the Cardinals on Monday, but eventually allowed one run on three hits over seven innings. Lynn is 2-1 lifetime against the Orioles and 6-3 overall at Guaranteed Rate Field.
away_pitcher_note: The lone bright spot in the Orioles' rotation, Means leads the American League with a 1.79 ERA. He has settled for no-decisions the past three times out despite holding opponents to six runs in 19 1/3 innings.

home_pitcher_note: Giolito battled through right side tightness during his start on Tuesday night against the Cardinals but made it through six innings for the victory, allowing two runs (one earned). He has 23 strikeouts over his last 20 innings.
away_pitcher_note: This will be the first start of the season for Akin, who replaces Dean Kremer in the rotation. Akin went 1-2 with 4.56 ERA in eight games (six starts) as a rookie down the stretch in 2020.

home_pitcher_note: McKenzie was sent down to Triple-A over a week ago, but he has yet to make a start for Columbus. After Zach Plesac's thumb injury, the team needed McKenzie back in the Majors to start on Wednesday, and he'll serve as the 27th man against the White Sox.
away_pitcher_note: Rodón hasn't truly struggled for any stretch this season, but he is 0-2 in his past three starts. Still, with a 2.55 ERA in that span -- and double-digit strikeouts in his past two outings -- the lefty has given the White Sox a chance to win every fifth day.

home_pitcher_note: Quantrill is set to make his first start of the year in Game 2 of the doubleheader against Chicago. Quantrill has worked out of the 'pen all year, so he's not stretched out to give the team too much length, but he has a 2.03 ERA in 17 games.
away_pitcher_note: Lambert, who debuted last season, was called up to make his 2021 season debut, as well as his first start in the Majors. In five starts with Triple-A Charlotte so far, Lambert has a 7.71 ERA, with 23 strikeouts in 11 2/3 innings.

home_pitcher_note: Bieber finally looked like 2020 Bieber once again in his last outing Thursday. The righty carried a no-hitter into the seventh inning against Detroit and allowed just one run on one hit (solo homer) with 12 strikeouts in seven frames.
away_pitcher_note: Cease is coming off his second double-digit strikeout performance of the season, having fanned 10 Orioles over six innings in a win on Thursday. He has allowed three or fewer runs in nine of 10 starts this season.

home_pitcher_note: Lynn was scheduled to work on short rest Wednesday after beating the Orioles Saturday. But a postponement in Cleveland put Lynn back on regular rest for the series and homestand opener Thursday vs. Detroit.
away_pitcher_note: Mize pitched five innings of one-run ball with seven strikeouts against the Yankees in his last outing. He leads the Tigers with 1.7 Wins Above Replacement, per Baseball Reference, this season.

home_pitcher_note: Keuchel had allowed five home runs over his first 10 starts before allowing three in five innings during his last trip to the mound against Baltimore. Keuchel finished May with a 3-0 record and a 4.40 ERA in five starts.
away_pitcher_note: Turnbull escaped a nobody-out, bases-loaded jam with only one run allowed against the Yankees in his last start, winning his fourth game of the season and first since his May 18 no-hitter.

home_pitcher_note: The White Sox ace had a tremendous month of May with a 4-2 record and a 2.41 ERA in six starts, striking out 45 over 37 1/3 innings. He has a 2.84 ERA over six starts this season at Guaranteed Rate Field.
away_pitcher_note: Skubal had arguably his best outing on Sunday, pitching six scoreless innings in Detroit’s victory over the Yankees. He made it look easy against a group of hitters that roughed him up for three homers in as many innings one month prior in the Bronx.

home_pitcher_note: Cease will take the bump to close out the four-game set with the Tigers. Cease has a proven track record of success against Detroit, sporting a 6-0 record with a 2.29 ERA and 37 strikeouts in 35 1/3 innings over six career starts.
away_pitcher_note: The Tigers haven’t officially announced Ureña’s return from the IL, but manager A.J. Hinch said he remains on track for the start after throwing a side session Thursday. He hasn’t pitched since leaving his May 26 start with right forearm tightness.

home_pitcher_note: Rodón wasn’t as sharp as he has been all season during his last start, allowing five runs (including three homers) over six innings against the Indians. But Rodón still struck out eight and walked one, giving his team a chance.
away_pitcher_note: Ray's changes in '21 have become the new normal for him -- walking very few while racking up the strikeouts. He's also providing length with at least six innings pitched in six of his last eight outings.
summary: 2021-06-08 - Toronto Blue Jays (1) @ Chicago White Sox (6) (Final)

home_pitcher_note: Lynn is 1-3 with a 5.45 ERA in seven career games (six starts) against Toronto. But the right-hander is 6-0 with a 1.38 ERA and a .150 opponents average over his past seven starts. Lynn has 36 strikeouts in his last 39 innings of work.
away_pitcher_note: Manoah was dominant in his debut then struggled in his encore, so this is his shot to find a groove. The No. 5 prospect is brimming with confidence and will benefit from spotting his fastball better in Chicago after allowing some hard contact in his last start.
summary: 2021-06-09 - Toronto Blue Jays (6) @ Chicago White Sox (2) (Final)

home_pitcher_note: Keuchel makes his 13th start of the season and second in June when he faces the Blue Jays in the finale of a three-game series. The southpaw is 4-0 with a 4.78 ERA over six career starts vs. Toronto.
away_pitcher_note: Ryu's last outing was very uncharacteristic, allowing six earned runs over 5 2/3 innings. He felt he was rushing his delivery, so look for the ace to bounce back after having some time to evaluate that.
summary: 2021-06-10 - Toronto Blue Jays (2) @ Chicago White Sox (5) (Final)

home_pitcher_note: Skubal set a career high with 11 strikeouts against the White Sox in Chicago on Saturday, and he has four consecutive outings with eight strikeouts or more. He’s just the fourth rookie since 2010 to post such a streak.
away_pitcher_note: Giolito makes his second straight start vs. the Tigers, after dropping a 4-3 home decision to Detroit on Saturday. The White Sox are 5-7 in Giolito’s 12 starts, and he has a 3.32 ERA in three career starts at Comerica Park.

home_pitcher_note: Ureña gets a rematch against the White Sox after giving up three runs on six hits over five innings on Sunday in Chicago in his return from the injured list. He hasn’t struck out more than two batters in an outing since May 8 against Minnesota.
away_pitcher_note: Cease absolutely dominates the Tigers. He has a 7-0 record with a 1.91 ERA over seven career starts against Detroit, striking out 47 over 42 1/3 innings. Cease has 14 scoreless innings in two wins over the Tigers this season.

home_pitcher_note: Funkhouser, who came up in the Tigers' farm system as a starter, will make his first Major League start as part of a bullpen game. The former University of Louisville star has been a revelation in relief (2.70 ERA in 13 appearances) since being called up from Triple-A Toledo in May.
away_pitcher_note: Rodón has not received a decision in three of his last five starts, going 0-2 with a 3.45 ERA. Over that span, he had 44 strikeouts in 28 2/3 innings, a .239 opponents average and received zero runs of support in three of those starts.

home_pitcher_note: Lynn has been on a roll lately, and is 5-0 with a 0.88 ERA in his past seven starts including Wednesday, when he held the Blue Jays to one run on four hits across seven innings.
away_pitcher_note: Glasnow is coming off another gem, a seven-inning win over the Nats on Tuesday, in which he allowed one run and struck out 11 with only one walk on 114 pitches. He's worked at least seven innings his last three times out and in four of his last five starts.
summary: 2021-06-14 - Tampa Bay Rays (5) @ Chicago White Sox (2) (Final)

home_pitcher_note: Keuchel is fresh off a win vs. Toronto last Thursday during which he fanned a season-high eight across six innings. The Rays have always given him trouble, though, and he's 1-5 with a 4.78 ERA in eight career starts against them.
away_pitcher_note: McClanahan has struggled through back-to-back short outings, as he's had trouble getting ahead of hitters. He's allowed seven runs on 10 hits and five walks in 6 1/3 innings over his last two starts after posting a 3.29 ERA in his first six outings.
summary: 2021-06-15 - Tampa Bay Rays (0) @ Chicago White Sox (3) (Final)

home_pitcher_note: Giolito's offspeed stuff was on point in his last start against the Tigers on Friday, a good sign as he continues to work on fine-tuning his repertoire. The righty has a 1.31 ERA in three career starts against Tampa Bay.
away_pitcher_note: Yarbrough is on a two-start winning streak this month, having allowed only two earned runs on nine hits with no walks and 12 strikeouts in 15 innings his last two times out. The left-hander has a 2.56 ERA in seven outings since the start of May.
summary: 2021-06-16 - Tampa Bay Rays (7) @ Chicago White Sox (8) (Final)

home_pitcher_note: Urquidy gave up three solo homers last Friday against the Twins, but those were the only blemishes in his seven-inning effort. He’s allowed 11 homers and issued 11 walks in 62 innings this season and has five quality starts.
away_pitcher_note: Cease will be making his second career start against Houston but his first appearance at Minute Maid Park. Cease has allowed two runs and struck out 17 over his last 12 innings in two starts, both coming vs. Detroit.

home_pitcher_note: Garcia had won five consecutive starts before giving up four runs (three earned) in 4 1/3 innings in last Saturday's loss to the Twins. As a starter, he has a 3.14 ERA and 1.06 WHIP in 57 1/3 innings.
away_pitcher_note: Rodón took a no-hitter into the seventh inning Sunday against the Tigers but settled for his third start this season of allowing no hits or one. Rodón has recorded 97 strikeouts over 66 2/3 innings while allowing only 39 hits.

home_pitcher_note: Valdez was dominant in his most recent outing at Minnesota on Sunday, holding the Twins to two runs (one earned) over seven innings. He has a 1.27 ERA and a 0.94 WHIP over three starts in June.
away_pitcher_note: Lynn had a personal six-game winning streak come to an end Monday night in a 5-2 setback to the Rays. Lynn fanned eight over six innings, marking his fifth start this season with eight or more strikeouts.

home_pitcher_note: McCullers was on a pitch count in his start vs. Texas on Tuesday, his first since returning from the IL with shoulder soreness. He yielded an earned run over 4 1/3 innings, using only a fastball-changeup combination in the first three innings.
away_pitcher_note: The left-hander pitched the first seven years of his career for the Astros but will be making his first start as a visitor at Minute Maid Park. Lance McCullers Jr., whom Keuchel referred to as being like his son, starts for Houston.

home_pitcher_note: Anderson was hit hard for five runs in the first inning last time out in Washington. However, he gave the Pirates much-needed length, going six innings while allowing only one more run to the Nats.
away_pitcher_note: Giolito has not found great Interleague success, posting a 4-7 record with a 5.49 ERA over 14 career starts vs. National League teams. He is 1-0 vs. the Pirates, which just so happened to be the no-hitter he threw in Chicago last season.

home_pitcher_note: It was unclear how long De Jong's stay in the Majors would be when the Pirates selected his contract to start on May 30. He says each start is a job audition, and he's passed the test so far; three of his four starts have seen two runs or fewer.
away_pitcher_note: The real interest Wednesday will be in Cease’s hitting, as he enters 3-for-3 at the plate in his career from an earlier performance this season vs. the Reds. Cease is 1-4 with a 4.55 ERA over six career Interleague starts.
